entry.title: automation
entry.content:
Yesterday and today I've been working on a small bash scrip to automate adding new posts, it's working pretty well so far I should be able to finish it off today. Just about 20ish lines of bash, nothing fancy.

It's clunky and a little more DIY than what I've worked on lately, but I think that's a good thing, as I'm learning a lot.

entry.title: Authentication and Todo list
entry.content: Well I have things working pretty well here, I think I've figured out why my ssh key wasn't working for git pushes, so Thi spost should work with that. I need to write a small bash script to automate new post creation, as the process is completely manual right now. Just a small thing to create the text file for a post, give it a totle ad insert it into the Makefile would be great.

entry.title: Hello, World
entry.content:
Testing! This is a new blog post. I decided, for whatever reason, that I wanted to play with some static site generators. I started with Jekyll and Octopress, but those were pretty rickety and fiddly and annoying.

So now I've switched over to the blogc utility, built in C and even more barebones. It was a lot simpler to get it up and running than the Ruby tools even though there were some odd Ruby requirements when compiling. I don't know if this will be a regular thing, but it's been interesting so far.
